passage_text: Abiogenesis vs Biogenesis. • Abiogenesis states that the origin of life is due to another nonliving material, or it is a spontaneous mechanism, whereas biogenesis reveals that the origin of life is due to another preexisting living organism or cells. However, finally scientists proved that the origin of life is actually caused by preexisting living organism, not by nonliving substances, and this opinion was known as “Biogenesis”. Abiogenesis. The RNA world hypothesis describes an early Earth with self-replicating and catalytic RNA but no DNA or proteins. It is generally accepted that current life on Earth descends from an RNA world, although RNA-based life may not have been the first life to exist.
